Class CPU

  • java.lang.Object
    • CPU

  • public class CPU
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstracts a CPU for the use of the MFQ simulation.
    Author:
    Min-Jae Yi

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Job currentJob 
      private boolean isBusy 
      private int quantumClock 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CPU()
      Initializes needed variables for the class.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Job clearCPU(int clockTime)
      Clears the CPU of the job that resides.
      void decClocks()
      Handles decrementing the CPU quantum and the time remaining of the job that resides in the CPU.
      boolean isBusy()
      Returns whether or not the CPU is currently processing a job.
      boolean jobFinished()
      Returns whether or not the job that is in the CPU is finished (remaining time of the job is 0).
      Job peekCPU()
      Returns the job that is currently on the CPU.
      Job preemptCPU()
      Forces the job out of the CPU and returns the job object.
      boolean quantumClockDone()
      Returns whether or not the CPU quantum clock is at 0.
      void submitJob(Job job)
      Adds a job into the CPU to be processed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CPU

        public CPU()
        Initializes needed variables for the class.

    • Method Detail

      • isBusy

        public boolean isBusy()
        Returns whether or not the CPU is currently processing a job.
        Returns:
        CPU is busy or not

      • jobFinished

        public boolean jobFinished()
        Returns whether or not the job that is in the CPU is finished (remaining time of the job is 0).
        Returns:
        Job is finished or not

      • quantumClockDone

        public boolean quantumClockDone()
        Returns whether or not the CPU quantum clock is at 0.
        Returns:
        CPU quantum clock is finished or not

      • peekCPU

        public Job peekCPU()
        Returns the job that is currently on the CPU.
        Returns:
        Current job or null if none

      • preemptCPU

        public Job preemptCPU()
        Forces the job out of the CPU and returns the job object. Also increments the job's queue level. Resets busy flag.
        Returns:
        The job that was preempted

      • clearCPU

        public Job clearCPU(int clockTime)
        Clears the CPU of the job that resides. This is different from preemptCPU() in that it will clock the job out of the system and does not increment the job's queue level. Resets busy flag.
        Parameters:
        clockTime -
        Returns:
        The job that has finished

      • decClocks

        public void decClocks()
        Handles decrementing the CPU quantum and the time remaining of the job that resides in the CPU.

      • submitJob

        public void submitJob(Job job)
        Adds a job into the CPU to be processed. Sets the CPU quantum to the appropriate amount of time according to the queue the job was in. Also sets the busy flag of the CPU.
        Parameters:
        job - Job to be processed in the CPU
